description: The Replicative Assessment of Spectrometric Equipment (RASE) is a software for evaluating the performance of radiation detectors and isotope identification algorithms. It uses a semi-empirical approach to rapidly generate synthetic spectra and inject into detector's software to obtain nuclide identification response. RASE facilitates studies of spectroscopic device performance and a quantitative assessment of its capabilities to correctly distinguish and identify isotopes of interest in realistic scenarios.
name: Replicative Assessment of Spectroscopic Equipment
